snippet: Detroit officials have raced to reach deals with city workers and others in an effort to expedite the process of exiting bankruptcy court by mid-October.
abstract: Judge Steven W Rhodes signs off on document that clears the way for tens of thousands of Detroit retirees, employees and bondholders to begin receiving ballots on the city's plan for rebuilding and shrinking its debt; Detroit officials, hoping to exit bankruptcy court my mid-October, are racing to reach deals with city workers and others in effort to ease and expedite the entire process.

byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and STEVEN YACCINO
byline.contributor: Monica Davey reported from Detroit, and Steven Yaccino from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: Detroit officials have raced to reach deals with city workers and others in an effort to expedite the process of exiting bankruptcy court by mid-October.

headline.main: Judge Paves Way for Voting on Detroit’s Recovery Plan as Two Police Unions Settle
headline.print_headline: Judge Paves Way for Voting on Detroit’s Recovery Plan as Two Police Unions Settle
